description.p: The Eclipse platform is designed for building integrated development environments (IDEs), server-side applications, desktop applications, and everything in between.
It comes with following extensions by default:

ul.li: JDT, which is required to use Eclipse for developing software written in the Java programming language.
PDE, which is required for developing Eclipse plugins.

description.p: However, the true power of Eclipse lies in extensions, such as:

ul.li: Mylyn - a great context tool hiding unnecessary piece of UI, thus making coding much faster.
CDT - adding support for C/C++ language
